hello everybody,
 
i admit that i'd make any sort of introduction when i jo=
ined the group since reading a few topics on the group's page,i understood =
i knew very little about the samurai and their history along with japan's h=
istory.and i admit that i didn't want to start posting and say something st=
upid until i learned more.well,here i am :).
 
my name is zeynep (all my fr=
iends call me zey and my friend gave me the japanese name 'kenshi' as i wan=
ted one).i'm from turkey and i'm very interested with the samurai and their=
 history,so i joined this group.i am currently unable to order books about =
the samurai via the internet and have difficulty finding them in turkey and=
 in bulgaria (where i currently reside since my father works here),though i=
 did come across ihara saikaku's 'the comrade loves of the samurai' in turk=
ish (and bought it) but i still am doing research on the net to broaden my =
knowledge concerning the samurai.
 
i've been checking out the maps on the =
samurai archives website and i wondered whether anyone knows the geographic=
al location of the taira clan.what i mean is where exactly was the head of =
the clan located on the map of japan.i admit that i don't know much about j=
apan's geography and studying the map of old japan's provinces didn't help.=
can anyone comment on this?
